newsitem.title: UK: EU seen awarding up to 90,000 T sugar at tender.
newsitem.headline: EU seen awarding up to 90,000 T sugar at tender.

text.p: The European Union (EU) is expected to award up to 90,000 tonnes of current series white sugar at its weekly tender later on Wednesday, traders said.
One trader forecast this week's authorised tonnage at between 85,000 and 90,000 tonnes, after the EU awarded 97,750 tonnes in its last tender on October 2.
But another forecast a lower tonnage range between 40,000 and 70,000 tonnes, noting less pre-hedging than expected in the Matif market on Tuesday.
"There wasn't much hedging in Paris yesterday -- I think people were a bit disappointed about the trend of the currencies as much as anything," he said.
But traders agreed on the maximum restitution for licences this week and forecast 44.940 Ecus (European Currency Units) per 100 kg of sugar, after last week's 45.064 Ecus.
Export licences are currently valid from October to March.
